name: Version 2.5.0
body:
Wow this is long... Thanks guys for patiently waiting for this release!

+EventDispatcher#registerTemporaryListener()
+EventDispather#waitFor()
+RequestBuilder, this class can be used as a promise system for discord requests (similar to RxJava)
+BotInviteBuilder

+Nickname and role mention support!
+Deaf/mute statuses have been added for users
+Permissions.ADMINISTRATOR
+Brand new Status api (see the Status class)
+IChannel#getUsersHere() and IVoiceChannel#getConnectedUsers()
+Logs all have log markers (see the LogMarkers class)
+RoleBuilder (@grandmind)
+Complete audio rework! (AudioChannel is now deprecated in favor of AudioManager [low level audio control] and AudioPlayer [high level audio control])
+getXByName() methods
+MessageList now has various bulk delete methods
+VoiceChannel user limit support
+ClientBuilder#withReconnects(), use this to have Discord4J automatically reconnect on a websocket disconnect
+Message pinning is now supported
+MessageBuildee#withQuote()
+ModuleLoader#getModules()
+Adds support for multiple classes in a module's manifest `module-requires` entry (separate the classes with semi-colons [;])
+Adds a fallback logger implementation when no slf4j logger implementation is present (see the Discord4JLogger class)
+Support for voice channel bitrates (@theIglooo)

*Events are now dispatched in an independent ThreadPool
*IListeners register via lambdas won't throw error messages anymore
*Class objects can be registered as event listeners
*Optionals are no longer used as parameters (#29)
*ReadyEvents will now only be dispatched after all the appropriate GuildCreateEvents are
*Various objects are much more threadsafe
*RequestBuffer is now easier to use when there is no return value
*RequestBuffer is more consistent in queueing retries
*MentionEvent is now more consistent
*ModuleLoader is now more consistent in loading modules
*Internal Permissions checking overhaul
*Bots can now play in multiple voice channels across guilds
*Voice-related events are more consistent (@theIglooo)
*Clouflare errors will no longer spam the console
*Fixes opus library loading on x86 linux systems
*Received heartbeats are now properly handled
*Unsent messages now throw a DiscordException
*Deprecated HTTP429Exception in favor of RateLimitException
*Implements v5 of the Discord gateway
*Event-related classes have been moved to the sx.blah.discord.api.events package
*Role caches are now properly maintained (#48)
*Updated examples (@grandmind)
*IVoiceChannel#join now properly checks required permissions (@theIglooo)
*Fixes MessageBuilder#withCode()
*Fixes IDiscordClient#logout() NPEs
*Improves invalid session handling
*Updates invite parsing regex (@dec)
*Fixes #59 (@phantamanta44)
*The IDiscordClient#isBot() status is now checked on user-only methods

-Deprecated features on 2.4.x have been removed
-Removes IDiscordClient#convertUserToBot()
-Jetty ws logging has been disabled by default, use DIscord4J.enableJettyLogging() to re-enable it
-Removed all references to xkcd invite codes (they were fun while they lasted)

name: Initial (Re-)Release!
body:
After lots of hard work, Discord4J now _fully_ implements all the features it should've already had. It has also undergone major refactoring, so you will find a few things marked as deprecated. Notable changes to developers using this api:
- DiscordClient is no longer a singleton instance, meaning that you could use multiple users in one application. In order to create a new instance use the new `ClientBuilder` class. Note, when creating an instance, Discord4J will warn you about any unsupported or deprecated features.
- The event dispatcher system is less stupid now, you could use `IListener` and `@EventSubscriber` interchangeably without messing with the event dispatcher instance.
- Releases are a thing now. You could download the dev version from my CI Server as well as using maven. For more information, look at the project's README.
- Shaded jars! No longer do you need to worry about dependency management with Discord4J

In the future I plan on adding a few unique features, but only after the implementation of the discord api is complete enough.
